newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian stocks up, led by foreign demand.
newsitem.headline: Colombian stocks up, led by foreign demand.

text.p: Colombian stocks edged up on Tuesday, led by foreign fund demand for brewing giant Bavaria.
Bogota's IBB index rose 0.13 percent to 1,069.68 amid a 1.8 billion peso trade while Medellin's IBOMED index rose 0.15 percent to 16,595.81 amid a 2.7 billion peso volume.
"At times there's a lot of liquidity in the market, at other times not. We're now seeing packets of shares coming on to the market after shareholders' annual assemblies," one Bogota trader said.

"Shareholders are selling and foreign funds have been waiting in the wings to see what they could snap up," said another Bogota broker. Bavaria said it will propose a share split to its investors in the next month in order to divide the company into investment and industrial operations.
Other gainers included Banco Bancoquia, up 1.2 percent to 3,606 in Bogota and 3.23 percent to 3,200 in Medellin.
The biggest gainer in Bogota was Banco Industrial Colombiano up 3.02 percent to 3,606. It rose 1.95 percent to 3,607 in Medellin.
